title: Ticket #5820: condor_status should read and write json,xml and new classads
description:
condor_status should be able to read any long form classad that it writes, -json, -xml, -long and new classads as well.

This will be controlled by adding an optional qualifier to the -long and -ads arguments, the qualifier can be one of the following.

  • long the traditional long form classad
  • xml XML form, the same as you get from -xml
  • json classads in JSON form, the same as you get from -json
  • new 'new' classads form, with ; at the end of each assignment and no newlines.
  • auto when reading, figure out what the form is by looking at the first 1 or 2 lines of the stream.
  • nosort when writing, don't sort the attributes before output.

So for example, these two are equivalent 

condor_status -long:json > json_file.ads
condor_status -json      > json_file.ads
And these should both read the input produced by the commands above 
condor_status -ads:json json_file.ads
condor_status -ads:auto json_file.ads
remarks:
2016-Aug-02 20:20:17 by bbockelm:
Is it possible to move the new parser code to the classad library so I can quit re-implementing the same thing in the python bindings?

The classad python module can't depend on the htcondor libraries...

2016-Aug-17 14:21:09 by johnkn:
We should instead discard this foolish notion that the classads library is independent of HTCondor. It makes work for us, and is of questionable benefit to the community.
